## Archifiltre

![](https://archifiltre.fabrique.social.gouv.fr/app/uploads/2024/07/Aime-par-Chloe-1-e1721076329956-150x150.png){width=150px}

**Archifiltre** is our recommended tool for visualizing and organizing your file structure. It is a free, open-source tool developed by French archivists, particularly relevant for humanities researchers.

### Key Features

- **Visual treemap** of your entire directory structure
- **Duplicate detection** across folders
- **Date-based filtering** to identify old/unused files
- **Tagging system** for organizing files
- **Export reports** for documentation

### Why Archifiltre for Digital Humanities?

- **Visualize research archives** - see your entire project structure at a glance
- **Identify duplicates** - find redundant files across versions
- **Date analysis** - track when files were created/modified across long-term projects
- **Prepare for data deposit** - organize before archiving in institutional repositories
- **Document collections** - generate reports for data management plans

### Use Cases in SSH Research

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
**Managing sources:**

- Organize interview recordings
- Track multiple transcription versions
- Map archival photograph collections
- Identify gaps in data collection
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
**Project documentation:**

- Prepare data for deposit (Zenodo, Nakala)
- Document for Data Management Plans
- Clean up before thesis submission
- Create inventory for collaborators
:::
:::

## Alternative Tools for File Organization

If you're looking for more widely-used international tools, here are excellent alternatives:

### 1. WinDirStat (Windows) / Disk Inventory X (macOS)

**Purpose:** Visualize disk space usage

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="60%"}
**Features:**
- Treemap visualization of disk usage
- Identify large files taking up space
- File type distribution analysis
- Completely free and open-source

**Best for:** Finding what's eating up your storage
:::

::: {.column width="40%"}
![WinDirStat visualization](/img/windirstat.jpg){width=100%}
:::
:::

**Download:**

- **WinDirStat** (Windows): <https://windirstat.net/>
- **Disk Inventory X** (macOS): <http://www.derlien.com/>
- **Baobab** (Linux): Pre-installed on most distributions

---

### 2. WinMerge (Windows) / Meld (Cross-platform)

**Purpose:** Compare and synchronize folders

**Features:**

- **Side-by-side folder comparison**
- Highlight differences between directory structures
- Identify duplicate, missing, or modified files
- **Merge or sync** folders selectively
- Great for backup verification

**Use cases:**

- Compare your working folder with your backup
- Find files that changed since last backup
- Identify duplicates across different locations

**Download:**

- **WinMerge** (Windows): <https://winmerge.org/>
- **Meld** (Windows/macOS/Linux): <https://meldmerge.org/>

**Documentation:**

- [WinMerge User Manual](https://manual.winmerge.org/)
- [Meld User Guide](https://meldmerge.org/help/)

---

### 3. FreeFileSync

**Purpose:** Backup and file synchronization

**Features:**

- **Mirror, update, or two-way sync** between folders
- Visual comparison of source and target
- Filter rules (include/exclude patterns)
- Batch jobs for automated backups
- Works with local drives, network shares, and cloud storage

**Perfect for:**

- Automated backup routines
- Keeping multiple copies in sync
- Implementing the 3-2-1 backup rule

**Download:** <https://freefilesync.org/>

**Tutorial:**

- [FreeFileSync Beginner's Guide](https://freefilesync.org/tutorials.php)
- [Video Tutorial](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=example)

---

### 4. TreeSize Free (Windows)

**Purpose:** Detailed disk space analysis

**Features:**

- Show folder sizes in Windows Explorer
- Drill down to find large files
- Export results to Excel
- Scheduled scans

**Download:** <https://www.jam-software.com/treesize_free>

---

## Recommended Workflow

For comprehensive file organization, consider using multiple tools:

1. **Visualization:** Start with **Archifiltre** or **WinDirStat** to see what you have
2. **Cleanup:** Use **dupeGuru** to find and remove duplicates
3. **Organization:** Reorganize based on insights
4. **Backup:** Use **FreeFileSync** for automated backups
5. **Verification:** Use **WinMerge** to verify backup integrity

---

## Tips for Choosing Tools

::: {.callout-tip}
## Selection Criteria

- **Start simple:** If you're overwhelmed, begin with just one tool (Archifiltre is a good all-rounder)
- **Match to your OS:** Some tools work better on specific platforms
- **Consider automation:** If you need regular backups, FreeFileSync is ideal
- **Open source preference:** All tools listed here have free/open-source options
:::
